Why is it important to fully understand how the `find` command works before running it?

It is important to fully understand how the `find` command works before running it because it can permanently delete files that match the specified criteria. If the command is not used correctly, it can lead to unintended file deletions, which can result in data loss.

# Keep only last 6 days - BE SURE to fully understand how it works, as every "rm" command!
find $DEST_FOLDER/wallet* -type f -mtime +6 -exec rm {} ;
```
